#summary Instructions on how to build piriti.

= Requirements =
Piriti is build using maven. Not all dependencies are available in remote repositories. To sucessfully build piriti you have to add some of its dependencies to your local repository:

  # Guice 2.0
  {{{
  mvn install:install-file 
      -DgroupId=com.google.inject 
      -DartifactId=guice 
      -Dversion=2.0 
      -Dpackaging=jar 
      -Dfile=<location on disk>
  }}}
  # Gin
  {{{
  mvn install:install-file 
      -DgroupId=com.google.gwt.inject 
      -DartifactId=gin 
      -Dversion=1.0 
      -Dpackaging=jar 
      -Dfile=<location on disk>
  }}}
  # GWTXPath
  {{{
  mvn install:install-file 
      -DgroupId=com.mouchel.gwt.xpath 
      -DartifactId=gwtxpath 
      -Dversion=1.0 
      -Dpackaging=jar 
      -Dfile=<location on disk>
  }}}  

= Build Instructions =

After installing these dependencies to your local repository, you should be able to build piriti by calling 
{{{
mvn clean install
}}}

If you working with eclipse you can generate the necessary project files by calling 
{{{
mvn eclipse:eclipse
}}} 
The generated project has the relevant GWT natures and is recognized by the Goole Eclipse plug-in.
